column1: '''Elaine Griffiths''' ([[1909]]-[[1996]]) was Fellow in English and Chair of the English Faculty Board at [[Wikipedia:St Anne's College
column3: [[University of Oxford|Oxford]].<ref name=Anne>[http://www.st-annes.ox.ac.uk/about/st-annes-history/biographies-of-founding-fellows-1958.html#c2291 Biographies of Founding Fellows (1958): M. Elaine Griffiths] at [http://www.st-annes.ox.ac.uk/ St Anne's College] (accessed 28 May 2011)</ref>

column1: After taking her degree in English
column2: Griffiths undertook research under the supervision of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
column3: acquiring an interest in [[Old English]] Philology.<ref name=Anne/> She soon became one of Tolkien's close friends
column4: and was one of the early readers of a manuscript of ''[[The Hobbit]]''. It was Griffiths who suggested [[Susan Dagnall]] of [[George Allen and Unwin|Allen & Unwin]] to borrow the typescript from Tolkien.<ref>"[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/815-The_Queen_of_Hobbits_For_Sale.php The Queen of Hobbits for Sale]" at [http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/index.php TolkienLibrary.com] (accessed 28 May 2011)</ref>

column1: Tolkien signed a copy of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' to her with a dedication in [[Quenya]]: ''Elainen [[tári]]n [[Periando|periand]]ion [[ar]] [[melde]]nya [[an-|an]][[yára]]n'' (to Elaine
column2: Queen of Hobbits and my very old friend).<ref>http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/856-most_expensive_Tolkien_book_in_the_world.php</ref><!--  Chronology is wrong(?)
